Title:
Mycosphaerella guttulata, a new ascomycete with a guttulate
spores found on fern in Chiang Mai, Thailand.
Keywords:
Fungi, fern, ITS, Mycosphaerellaceae, leaf spot,
tropics
Abstract:
A survey of Mycosphaerella and its anamorphs in Thailand
has been carried out since 2008. The main aim of the study is to provide
a database of this group of fungi for supporting the identification
which is still difficult for many mycologists and plant pathologists in
this region. Mycosphaerella guttulata sp. nov., found on Platycerium
wallichii, is proposed as a new species in this report as this fungus is
distinct from other Mycosphaerella species by having guttulate and pale
brown spores. Phylogenetic examination of internal transcribed spacer
(ITS) region of nuclear ribosomal DNA indicated an anamorph-teleomorph
connection with the genus Pseudocercospora.
